definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Dashu knows to lower his head when he wants to get under his bed.
sentences.chinese: 大樹爬進小牀的時候會把頭低下，匍匐前進。

sentences.english: This is more like the Creeping Crud.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的要更象是”匍匐前進的骯髒東西“。

sentences.english: Why prefer to crawl through life?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼要在生活中匍匐前進呢？

sentences.english: Such as crawling down, support the body with his elbow alternately crawl as well.
sentences.chinese: 如往下爬行，用胳膊肘支撐身體交替着匍匐前進爲好。

sentences.english: He crawl on his belly under the lee of a stone dyke.
sentences.chinese: 他在一條石堤的掩護下匍匐前進。

sentences.english: The soldiers were bellying through the rice paddy.
sentences.chinese: 戰士們在稻田裏匍匐前進。

sentences.english: The private in front of him began crawling.
sentences.chinese: 在他前面的士兵開始臥倒，匍匐前進。

sentences.english: The ceiling was so low that we had to crawl.
sentences.chinese: 天花板太低了，我們只好匍匐前進。

sentences.english: The child is going on all fours.
